p:
Evidence of COVID-19-associated increases in circulating cardiac troponin T (cTnT) and cardiac troponin I (cTnI) above the 99th percentile reference limit are emerging in the literature.
14
– 17 Detectable cTnI has been observed in most COVID-19 patients. In a retrospective cohort analysis, cTnI was significantly elevated in 54 subjects who died compared with 137 survivors (median [IQR] cTnI 22 [5.6–83.1] ng/L vs. 3 [1.1–5.5] ng/L, P≤0.0001).
